name: Entropy and Second Law
explanation: Entropy (S) measures disorder or randomness. Second law: entropy of isolated system always increases. ΔS = Q/T for reversible processes. Boltzmann: S = k_B ln W (W = number of microstates). Entropy explains why processes are irreversible, why heat flows from hot to cold, and the arrow of time. Fundamental to understanding thermodynamics and statistical mechanics.

examples.problem: 1000J heat flows into system at 300K. What is entropy change?

examples.solution: Systems naturally evolve toward more probable (disordered) states
steps: This is the second law of thermodynamics
